    • Constructor Detail

      • Pawn

        public Pawn(java.lang.String color,
            Chessboard board,
            int row,
            int column)
        Pawn constructor

        The constructor for Pawn calls the ChessPiece super constructor.

        Parameters:
        color - Description: The color of the Pawn. Can be w or b for white and black.
        board - Description: The chessboard the Pawn is located in.
        row - Description: The row the Pawn starts on in the chessboard.
        column - Description: The column the Pawn starts on in the chessboard.

    • Method Detail

      • isValidVerticalMovement

        public boolean isValidVerticalMovement(int verticalMovement)
        Determines whether a vertical movement is valid for the selected Pawn piece This method checks to see whether the pawn can move vertically the given amount of squares. Usually it will be -1 for white pawns and 1 for black pawns, but it can also be -2 or 2 for the first move. If the piece is still at start, the both 1 and 2 (absolute value) space movements will return true, after being moved only 1 space movements will return true for Pawns.
        Returns:
        Description: boolean describing whether a vertical movement is a valid option from the selected pieces current position

      • isValidCapture

        public boolean isValidCapture(int verticalMovement,
                              int horizontalMovement)
        Determines whether a move, specifically a capture, is valid for the selected Pawn piece This method checks to see whether the pawn can diagonally capture a piece. If there is a piece vertically and horizontally by the given amount of squares and it is of an opposite color, then the pawn can capture it.
        Returns:
        Description: boolean describing whether a capture is a valid option from the selected pieces current position

      • enPassant

        public boolean enPassant(int verticalMovement,
                         int horizontalMovement)
        Determines whether a enpassant rule is in effect and usable This method checks to see whether the pawn is in the position to use enpassant rule to capture another pawn piece from the enemy
        Returns:
        Description: boolean describing whether the enpassant rule is valid for the current piece

      • getAvailableMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAvailableMoves()
        Gets all available moves for the Pawn.

        Calls the isValidVerticalMovement and getAvailableCaptures functions for the squares that a Pawn can move to: on the first turn they can move twice vertical, otherwise they may move vertical one space forward. They can also move diagonally one space to capture another piece

        Specified by:
        getAvailableMoves in class ChessPiece
        Returns:
        Description: Returns the ArrayList of all possible moves the Pawn can take from its current location.

      • getAvailableCaptures

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAvailableCaptures()
        Gets all available moves for the Pawn.

        This function returns an arraylist of all possible capturing moves for the pawn. This is a separate function than getAvailableMoves() for determining check, because a pawn moving forward does not capture that piece.

        Returns:
        Description: Returns the ArrayList of all possible attacks the Pawn can take from its current location.

      • move

        public void move(java.lang.String command)
        Overwrites default move function from ChessPiece

        This function returns nothing and moves the Pawn piece to the designated location by calling the super class move function and then considering enpassant and other special rules of the pawn piece.

        Overrides:
        move in class ChessPiece
        Parameters:
        command - Description: the designated location to travel to for this Pawn piece.

      • promote

        public void promote(java.lang.String piece)
        Implements promotion rule of chess

        This function returns nothing and promotes the current Pawn piece to a specified new piece type upon arrival at the other side of the chess board depending on input: Bishop, Rook, Knight, or Queen; with Queen being the default.

        Parameters:
        piece - Description: the requested piece type to transform the Pawn into.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the String representation of this piece.

        Returns a String representation of this piece, which is its one-letter color appended by "p", representing its status as a Pawn.

        Specified by:
        toString in class ChessPiece
        Returns:
        Description: Returns the string representation of this piece.
